     duplicates from being      indexed
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=284768837

Even at the risk of holding a monolog here :-) ... let me share my
findings with a patched version of the DeDuplicator:
The processed logfile is the second of two crawls of the same 5 sites. The
logfile from the first crawl was fed into the DeDuplicator index used by
the second crawl.

Original DeDuplicator (0.3) (including text/.*):

Indexing: jobs\Test-20061214204316551\logs\crawl.log
 - Mode: BOTH
 - Mime filter:  "^foo/bar" (blacklist)
 - Includes
 - Iterator: is.hi.bok.deduplicator.CrawlLogIterator
   - Handles Heritrix style crawl.log files
Target: c:\Test\crawls\index
 - Add to existing index (if any)
Indexed 10000 - Last URL from 20061214215657902
Indexed 20000 - Last URL from 20061214222432461
Indexed 30000 - Last URL from 20061214233243965
Indexed 35004 items (skipped 0)
Total run time: 8m3s435ms


Patched DeDuplicator (including text/.*)

Indexing: jobs\Test-20061214204316551\logs\crawl.log
 - Mode: BOTH
 - Mime filter:  "^foo/bar" (blacklist)
 - Includes
 - Skip duplicates: yes
 - Iterator: is.hi.bok.deduplicator.CrawlLogIterator
   - Handles Heritrix style crawl.log files
Target: c:\Test\crawls\index
 - Add to existing index (if any)
Indexed 10000 - Last URL from 20061214231927479
Indexed 15506 items (skipped 19498)
Total run time: 3m11s836ms


Patched DeDuplicator (skipping text/.*):

Indexing: jobs\Test-20061214204316551\logs\crawl.log
 - Mode: BOTH
 - Mime filter: ^text/.* (blacklist)
 - Includes
 - Skip duplicates: yes
 - Iterator: is.hi.bok.deduplicator.CrawlLogIterator
   - Handles Heritrix style crawl.log files
Target: c:\Test\crawls\index
 - Add to existing index (if any)
Indexed 2422 items (skipped 32582)
Total run time: 37s824ms

- Max
